menu.description: A staple Kenyan dish made from maize flour cooked with water to a dough-like consistency. Served with your choice of stew or sauce.
A fragrant Somali rice dish cooked with spices, typically served with meat, vegetables, and salad.
Savory triangular pastries filled with minced meat, onions, and various spices. A popular snack in both Kenyan and Somali cuisine.
Grilled meat (commonly goat or beef) marinated in Kenyan and Somali spices. Served with a side of vegetables or bread.
Sweet, fried East African doughnut, often served as a snack or dessert.
Somali pancake-like bread, often eaten at breakfast, served with honey or stew.
